intro: Eriogonum heracleoides var. rydbergii, commonly known as Rydberg's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and well-drained soils. The genus Eriogonum, to which it belongs, is known for its diverse array of flowering species, many of which are adapted to arid environments.
